name: The Barber Shop
description: The Barber Shop brewpub is located in downtown Dripping Springs, Texas in a historic building that began life in 1924. In its earliest life, the building served as a garage before later becoming a barber shop. In addition to a well-considered selection of popular local, national, and international beers and wines, we have a tap or two of our own special brews!

name: The Barking Duck Brewing Co.
description: The Barking Duck Brewing Co is a NEW brewery to open in Charlotte, NC! Providing a new and fresh approach to craft brewing!

name: The Beer Company
description: The Beer Company is a locally owned restaurant and brewery. Our hand crafted brews have fresh ingredients and a great, rich taste. We brew just feet away from where you'll enjoy your quality beer and delicious meal. If you appreciate quality, you'll love The Beer Company.

name: The Beer Diviner Tap Room & Market
description: New York Farm Brewery Tap Room and Market    I brew small, controlled batches using Brew Magic's advanced Recirculating Infusion Mash System (RIMS). The result is smooth, delicious pale, red, stout and medieval gruit ales - or any beer you care to custom order. Each bottle is filled by hand and conditioned at optimum temperatures. In 2012, I received my licenses for Bly Hollow Brewery, d.b.a.The Beer Diviner.

name: The Beer Research Institute
description: The Beer Research Institute is a gathering place where people can meet over a pint and a good meal. The tap list will be ever changing and the food is made from scratch. As the name implies, we will be innovative in our brewing and in the kitchen.    Our focus will be specialty runs of craft beer focusing on aggressive West Coast style American ales and Belgian style ales. We're just a couple of Beer Geeks who like to make great beer! Our kitchen will offer scratch made craft food that will pair perfectly with our unique beer offerings.

name: The Beer'd Brewing Co.
description: The Beer'd Brewing Co. is a nano brewery located in Stonington, Connecticut. We will welcome visitors into our tasting room to sample our offerings and purchase half gallon growlers for takeaway. Also an exclusive selection of local bars and restaurants will offer our ales on draft.

Our goals are to create an ambitious variety of high-quality beers, operate a comfortable taproom and lounge in which to serve them, and to be a part of the ongoing reinvention of Braddock.

name: The Brew Gentlemen Beer Co.

From that first day it has been our goal to provide our customers with the guidance, equipment and the freshest ingredients to produce quality, hand-crafted beers in an environment that is professional, safe and fun.  Fourteen years and 35,000 batches later, we are still committed to our customers' needs and desires. We invite you to visit our brewery to have a "look-see", visit with our expert brewing staff, or try brewing a batch from our "tried-and-true" recipe list.  we guarantee you'll be hooked!

name: The Brewer's Cabinet
description: Our small batch brewery allows us the flexibility not to be limited by popular fads, current trends or industry pressure in crafting our beers.    Our Brew Masters have been fully empowered so that there are no limits on creativity or style. We only ask that they do what they do best and brew with passion and love. We will also be featuring an impressive selection of guest draft handles and bottle selection to help compliment our own beers.    With a small kitchen onsite, we will be creating a fresh and local menu for our customers with an emphasis on quality ingredients that pair superbly with our brews. We want to create a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere for our customers, so that they can enjoy the environment no matter what time of the day, nor what the occasion is.    The Brewer’s Cabinet will focus on spreading awareness of the local brewing community. We hope to feature local commercial breweries and their great beers, which we hope will lead to a series of collaborative projects in creating new beers. We want a strong local home brewing community, that is part of the brewery, with the invitation to come in and help design beers with our brew masters. We truly want to be a “Brewer’s Cabinet” for the Reno area!

description: We are Erie’s exclusive brewpub & restaurant serving up fresh handcrafted ales paired with a unique menu of exceptional quality. Come & join us for a meal in the breathtaking Rotunda. Then join us for summers in the Trackside Beer Garden where you can enjoy a pint of ale as the trains go barreling by.

name: The Brewing Lair
description: Lets have fun with beer outdoors, because we don't have much room in the brewery. So come play Disc Golf, Walk in the woods or hang out on the patio where you can enjoy a fresh brew and surf the net.

name: The Bronx Brewery
description: We're a small craft brewery in the South Bronx, New York and have a maniacal love for two things in this world: beer and the Bronx. Cheers!    The Bronx Brewery is a craft brewer and distributor based in the South Bronx. It launched in 2011 by a small team with two things in common: a maniacal focus on creating high-quality beer and a passion for the Bronx. Its traditionally-crafted ales use only premium and minimally-processed materials to create fresh, bold beer from a borough known for its own uniquely bold character. The team is enthused to bring a rich brewing tradition back to the Bronx and craft a beer that the people of the Bronx and New York City can be proud to call their own.

name: The Bruery
description: A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.    Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.

name: The Byron Bay Brewing Co
description: The Byron Bay Brewery Bar / Restaurant is the home of Byron Bay Premium Ale and is one of Byron's newest attractions. Our Pale Larger is now available in Liquor Land, First Choice and Vintage Cellars bottle shops around Australia.

name: The Cannon Brewpub
description: If the Cannon Brewpub had an old man, it would be Jim Newman. A U.S. Army Ranger, Jim had just returned Stateside from Haiti when he attended a party hosted by Dr. Jack Blalock. At the soiree, he was introduced to a kindred soul named William Gantt. Their conversation soon turned to the quality of beer in Columbus. Needless to say, the tone was bitter and the language seasoned with expletives. When Jim explained that in Oregon, where he came of age, there was a vibrant scene of restaurants and bars that housed their own microbreweries that crafted their own distinct beers that could only be enjoyed at the source, Gantt understandably replied, "$#@*!".    What began as a conversation soon became an obsession and, in 1996, the firm Warner and Worth was incorporated to see their shared dream come true.

name: The Celt Experience

name: The Church Brew Works
description: Nestled in historic Lawrenceville, this turn of the century cathedral church turned Brewpub offers a heavenly atmosphere! Enjoy our award winning handcrafted brews and American "Eclectic" cuisine.

name: The Commons Brewery
description: The Commons Brewery is a small craft brewery located in Southeast Portland, Oregon. We are inspired by European brewing tradition and Northwest grown ingredients. We take a very hands-on approach to brewing our small batch beers.    The Commons was born as Beetje Brewery in the garage of Mike Wright on a 1 barrel nano system. It did not take long before Mike was dreaming of expanding the operation and upgrading to a true commercial system. That dream was realized with a new space and a new 7bbl system.

name: The Corner Cafe & Brewery
description: At The Corner Café and Brewery we are much more than a business that serves great meals.  We are a comfortable corner restaurant with a terrific and unique menu and our own brewery.  Patrons enjoy creative breakfasts, lunches, dinners or excellent wines and amazing hand crafted beers.     The atmosphere incorporates an eclectic and warm interior with local Lighthouse Center of the Arts member’s paintings.  Our cast of characters at The Corner Café top off the genuinely relaxed and fun experience at this unique and quirky restaurant.

name: The Dayton Beer Company
description: The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.    We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.    The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

name: Rochester
description: The Distillery is an award winning high energy bar and restaurant that offers fantastic ambiance and service for any drinking and dining occasion whether it's business, pleasure or a celebration.     We created a restaurant that offers a large selection of draft beers, a diverse menu of American fare, non-stop sports viewing entertainment and play a heady selection of classic rock music on a state-of-the-art audio system to ensure that all the bases are covered. On December 11th, 1980 the original Distillery Restaurant opened on Mt Hope Avenue in Rochester, New York. It quickly became a spot for locals who met over good food and cold beer to discuss the various issues of the day, catch up with friends, make new acquaintances and celebrate life.

description: We ain't serious about a lotta things, but beer ain't one of 'em!™ Available in GA, AL, VA, FL and CA, The Fat Cat™ Beer Company, LLC is dedicated to providing a palate worthy handcrafted beer experience. Iconic packaging, award worthy beer, competitive pricing and an all round good attitude makes us Fat Cat™ indeed.    We believe in maintaining the smallest carbon footprint possible which is why we contract brew our own recipes (a/k/a Statements of Process for all you beer geeks) and why most if not all of our beer is packaged in a can. Our Fat Cat™ Lager was the FIRST handcrafted beer in a can when it made its debut in 1995!

description: Born in the majesty of the Rocky Mountain Front, which also lends us our name, The Front Brewing Company is one on Montana's newest breweries. Located a stone's throw from the beautiful Missouri in the West Bank One development in Great Falls, we began brewing in the summer of 2012. Using Montana's finest barley coupled with only the highest quality speciality malts, hops, yeast, and good clean water we use only the best ingredients in our beer. Our beer's which are unique versions of classic and modern beer styles pay homage to the great brewers of yesterday and today, while inspiring the future. We believe in beer made RIGHT here to be enjoyed anywhere. Cheers

name: Gahan House

name: The Gem and Keystone
description: We are proud to offer a twist on the classic brewpub; serving handcrafted ales and lagers brewed on premises, providing “food lovers dining” which emphasizes a seasonal menu using local and sustainable ingredients and consistently delivering exceptional service. What more can you ask for?    Also known as Shawnee Craft Brewery

name: The Granary 'Cur & Brew
description: We strive to make fresh, handcrafted, honest beers that can be enjoyed by all.  All of our beer is made within the four walls of our restaurant, which means that when it hits your glass it is the freshest beer you can get.   Our beers are never filtered or pasteurized and are always full of character and flavor.  We brew styles from American and Belgian to anything in between.  We typically brew our beers with four ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and San Antonio water.   However we have been known to add things like coffee, fruit, spices, and anything else that might catch our fancy.    At The Granary we love beer as beer helps to enrich our lives.  We take our beer and food seriously and we hope to politely challenge people’s perspective of how beer can be paired with food.  We believe that every meal that is served can be made better when paired with the right style of beer.  This is not your grandma’s beer.

description: The Keefe brothers expanded into Toronto in 1991 after starting up the Granite Brewery in Halifax six years prior. Granite Brewery produces a wide variety of brews and is focused on bringing a rich, classic, old English taste to the public palate.

name: Fitchburg
description: The Great Dane Pub & Brewing Company was established by college friends Eliot Butler and Rob LoBreglio. The two dreamed of starting a Brewpub that offered many varieties of house-brewed ales and lagers and hearty made-from-scratch pub fare to accompany the beers. The original Downtown location opened in November 1994 and expanded with the addition of a pool hall in 1996. The wild success of the first Great Dane led to the decision to open more pubs in the Madison area.    The Fitchburg Great Dane began operations in 2002 and the Hilldale pub followed in 2006. In 2009, the Hilldale pub expanded its brewery and opened a 4,000 square foot pool hall. Additionally, in May of 2009, the first Great Dane outside of the Madison area debuted in Wausau, Wisconsin. The Wausau Great Dane added a 100 seat beer garden and outdoor bar in the spring of 2011. In November 2010, the fifth Great Dane began operations in Grandview commons, off of Cottage Grove Road on Madison's east side.

description: The Grifter Brewing Company began in early 2012 when three home brewers were given the opportunity to take their recipes from the backyard, to a brand new shiny stainless steel brewery in Sydney’s Inner-west.  Since then the three have been honing their skills and unleashing their hand crafted ales across Sydney & Australia. Quality over quantity is always the motto as they focus on producing unique beers that remain highly drinkable. No corners are cut with the use of high quality ingredients and traditional brewing methods.

description: Ilkley Brewery was re-established in the town after a gap of nearly 100 years in 2009. We have a clear philosophy - to brew world class beers distinctive in style, flavour and character. When we say we are passionate about beer, we mean REALLY passionate and this is clearly expressed in our award winning range of beers and ales. Our philosophy starts with the raw materials we use, water from The Yorkshire Dales, the finest English malted barley and hops, sourced by our brewer from all over the world. We let those simple ingredients speak for themselves and combine them with skill and patience to brew beers that are balanced, exceptional and just

name: The Kernel Brewery
description: The brewery springs from the need to have more good beer. Beer deserving of a certain attention. Beer that forces you to confront and consider what you are drinking. Upfront hops, lingering bitternesses, warming alcohols, bodies of malt. Lengths and depths of flavour. We make Pale Ales, India Pale Ales and old school London Porters and Stouts towards these ends. Bottled alive, to give them time to grow.

name: The Kingston Brewing Company
description: The Kingston Brewing Company is Ontario's oldest brew pub, established in 1986, and is Canada's oldest wine-producing pub. Beers, wines, ciders and soda pops are made on the premises.    Food is pub standard with unique twists with beer used in many of the recipes. A courtyard and street-front patio, as well as a banquet room (known as the Dragon's Lair), makes this pub is a must visit.    A large collection of beer memorabilia and pub photos will also keep your eyes busy for days and inspire more than a few conversations. The building itself is an 1800's-era brick and stone — originally used as a telegraph office — and the original vaults are still in use.

name: The Lab Brewing Company
description: Beer. Food. Music. It is based on these fundamental ingredients - the trifecta of entertainment - that The LAB Brewing Co. was born.  We take them all -- our beer, our food, and our music-- equally seriously. And we take great effort to combine them all to create a haven for all who share our appreciation for drinking, eating and being merry.    Beer lovers rejoice. With more than 25 handpicked microbrews on tap we have you covered. And that’s before adding our house brews, handcrafted by our brewmaster on site to the mix. From the aggressively hopped IPA Bad Influence to the oh-so-strong Take Her Home Belgian Tripel, our house brews not only pack a punch, but they are sure to awaken your taste buds. Beer aficionados and casual drinkers are encouraged to seek out our head brewer Roger for a tour of the premises or to talk shop.    Large stunning copper fermentation vessels align the restaurant and contribute to a unique dining experience. The setting is a perfect match for our eclectic American cuisine. Menu favorites include BBQ duck quesadilla, white lasagna and Alaskan cod in a hazelnut sage brown butter sauce. No, this isn’t your typical “bar food” – though the LAB Burger is to die for. Everything is fresh farm to table.

description: We’re a craft brewery that produces premium beer in small batches where quality, not quantity, is our main concern. We produce beer with flavour and aroma. It’s that simple.    We don’t compromise on ingredients and we make sure that they are plentiful in each batch. We couldn’t make the beer we are passionate about if we cut corners. Yep, we admit to being just a little bit fussy.

name: The Livery
description: Over one hundred years ago, the building known as the Palace Livery provided a vital service making it a unique gathering place for residents of and travelers to Southwest Michigan. This former horse stable has been brought back to life as The Livery. Located at 190 5th street, in the Arts District of downtown Benton Harbor, Michigan, the Livery features 12 taps of "Hand-Forged Microbrew", 2 Real Ale taps, an outdoor bier garden, free WIFI, and a Café serving great food. Music and other live entertainment are regularly featured in The Upper Livery entertainment venue. You must be age 21 or older to enter The Livery. People under age 21 must be accompanied by parent or legal guardian.

description: The Lone Wolfe Brewing Co., is a one-man, one-barrel, sustainable nano-brewery, located in the heart of downtown Wolfeboro, NH. Dedicated to brewing hand-crafted, small batch ales, the brewery features a tasting room, with an ever-rotating tap list.

name: The Lost Abbey
description: Founded in 2006, Port Brewing and The Lost Abbey produce an extensive line-up of continental and American- inspired ales and lagers. Under the direction of visionary brewmaster and co-founder Tomme Arthur, the brewery has garnered dozens of awards in its seven-year history including the 2007 Great American Beer Festival Small Brewery of the Year, The 2008 world Beer Cup Champion Small Brewery and the 2013 Champion Brewery at the San Diego International Beer Festival. The company’s beers, many of which are aged in oak barrels for 12 months or longer, are universally recognized for their complexity, unique flavors and bold boundary-pushing styles.

name: The Lost Borough Brewing Co.
description: The Lost Borough Brewing Company is the realization of a dream for three life long friends Dave Finger, James Meyer and Dan Western in search of the perfect pint of craft beer brewed right here in the Rochester. After years of experimentation with all styles of artisan beers we have decided to leave our mark by opening a local brewery where we can share our passion with others and provide truly difference craft beer experience.

name: Restaurant & Brewery
description: A family-friendly restaurant featuring Prime beef burgers, thin-crust pizza, and craft-brewed beers, including 6 brewed on the premises.    When you name your restaurant after Trappist monks who've spent centuries perfecting their craft, you're serious about your beer. That's why we hired a master to craft our house brews, and why our beer list spans the globe. With everything from refreshing pilsners that match the lightness of our thin-crust pizza to dark, rich ales that stand up to our decadent burgers, you're certain to find a new favorite at The Lucky Monk. We're sure that our Prime beef burgers — served with hand-cut fries — will be the juiciest you've ever had. Our other house specialty, pizza, is crisp and generously topped with fresh ingredients. And we round out our menu with vibrant, flavorful salads; a handful of classic, satisfying American entrées; and some sweet surprises.    Whether you're settling in at our bar or relaxing with your friends and family in our comfortable dining room, our delicious food and drink and warm welcome are sure to elevate your soul.

name: The Mansfield Brewing Company
description: The Mansfield Brewing Company is a small batch brewery that produces high quality craft beers for the discerning drinker.  The Mansfield Brewing Company produces premium, naturally brewed beer.  Made with the finest quality malted grains and hops, producing refreshing beers with hop aromas and malt flavours. Our beer is naturally brewed, with no preservatives or additives. Bottle-conditioned beer may contain a small amount of sediment.  Like our Pale Ale brewed with a portion of Crystal malt along with dry hopping late in the fermentation makes for a refreshing beer with hoppy aromas and malty flavours.

name: The Mash House Brewery & Chophouse
description: We use no preservatives and only the finest ingredients at our on-site microbrewery: malted barley, hops, yeast and pure water. Our beer begins in our grain silo out front, is converted into "mash" with the addition of water, then ferments and ages in our custom-designed brewhouse—assuring our customers will receive the freshest pint possible. And there are seven ways to try our award-winning brews: by the pint (16 oz.), by the half yard (25 oz.), by the pitcher (64 oz.), by the hopper (116 oz. mini-keg), by the Mini Mash (any four beers on tap), by the Mondo Mash (4 oz. glasses of each of our 9 drafts), or by the Growler (take it to go!)

Whether it’s a dry-hopped Northwest IPA or a malt-heavy Porter, the Prodigal Son is dedicated to exploring the possibilities of grain, hops and yeast. description: We are the first and only brew pub in San Marcos, Texas.    Meet our brewer, Robert Brushaber. He has been homebrewing since the 90′s, and has graduated from the American Brewers Guild with a Craft Brewers Apprenticeship (CBA) in 2010. He apprenticed at the Real Ale Brewery in Blanco, and began brewing at the Root Cellar in 2012. The house beers brewed by Robert are Alison’s Ale, Cream Steam, Santa Fe Stout, and a Gluten Free IPA.    Alison’s Ale - A highly complex, clean and refreshing taste with a blend of six different malts and three different hops.    Cream Steam - Steam Beers are in a category all their own. Is it a lager? Is it an ale? Actually, it’s a lager brewed at ale temperatures. This higher temperature fermentation produces a beer with more “fruity” qualities than your average lager. The hops are 100% Northern Brewer, but Robert has lowered the hop bill to make this Steam Beer a bit more creamy and smooth.    Santa Fe Stout – This dry Stout, moderately bittered with Kent Golding hops, has flavor notes that remind me of a cup of dark coffee sipped from a warm mug on a cold Santa Fe morning.    Gluten Free Beer - Made with Sorghum, Honey, and Hops.

name: Thirsty Planet Brewing Company
description: We at Thirsty Planet Brewing believe our purpose is multi-faceted. It begins with just good, old-fashioned passion. Beer is our passion. We enjoy the history of beer, its humble, but amazing beginnings, the way it brings people together, and it’s unbelievable versatility. We truly believe you should follow your passion and enjoy life. How better to do that than open Thirsty Planet Brewing Company.    Our purpose then morphs into doing the right thing. For us, this includes being environmentally conscious. We have laced filters in our drains for run-off water, so we can use that water to irrigate our lawns and plants. We also plan to purchase solar panels for our brewery. We recycle, and you will quickly learn that after visiting our beautiful tasting room. Check out our bar, you will see what we mean.    Another important aspect of doing the right thing is through charitable donations. We have been truly blessed in life and want to give to those who are in need of a blessing. A portion of our Yellow Armadillo Wheat sales will go to a local cancer research/support foundation, and a portion of our Thirsty Goat Amber sales will go to help purchase farm animals (maybe goats?) for needy people in third world countries. So, not only can we feel good for helping people, you can feel good every time you purchase Thirsty Planet beer. It’s a win-win situation!!!

description: ThirstyBear Brewing Co. is San Francisco's only certified organic brewery.  ThirstyBear hand-crafts beers of every description: ales, lagers, barrel-aged, Belgian-inspired, cask conditioned, wet-hopped, dry-hopped - all inspired by tradition and modern creativity. Our brewery crafts only organic beers, ensuring that the beers you consume are good to you and good for our earth.  Our restaurant pairs its beers with Spanish inspired tapas and paellas sourced from the plethora of local and often organic farms that grace our region.  As the only San Francisco certified green brewery-restaurant, we promote the business of sustainability. Founded on September 13, 1996, ThirstyBear is now the oldest brewery-restaurant in San Francisco.

name: Main Cidery
description: Born out of a passion for making cider in the best possible way, combined with belief in the quality of Scottish produce, and asking ‘why not?’, came Thistly Cross Cider; Scotland’s award winning farmhouse ciders. Established as a collaboration between farmer, Ian Rennie, and artist-turned-cidermaker, Peter Stuart, in 2008, Thistly Cross has gained a reputation for making ciders that people rave about.    Based at the Cider Shed on South Belton Farm, in the heart of the East Lothian countryside, we’re involved in every aspect of making our award-winning Scottish farmhouse cider. From pressing the Scottish apples and strawberries, to achieving the smooth, balanced Thistly Cross flavour by fermenting with Champagne yeast then maturing for six months; we’re invested at every step of the cider-making process, from apple to cider.

We offer eleven unique beers (7 ales and 4 lagers) that are highly respected and recognized for consistency and quality. description: At Thorn Street Brewery, we are committed to bringing the neighborhood brewery back to reality and making you that better beer. It’s a neighborhood where folks pride themselves on walking or riding their bike to get locally produced food, where people devote large parts of their property to growing their own edibles, where people love gardening, fishing, and of course brewing their own beers. No where that I have seen in a major city is there such a community where the residents seem so bound together by a common philosophy. Reduce your carbon footprint, eat local, buy local, produce something local, be self sufficient as much as you can, smile, and please try to leave the world a little better than you found it, because, after all, we are just renting it.

description: Three Floyds Brewing Company LLC was founded in 1996 by brothers Nick and Simon with their father Mike Floyd. The original brewery was built by Nick and Simon in a run down warehouse located in Hammond, Indiana. The first beers brewed by the brothers were designed to be a departure from the fairly bleak craft brewing scene in the region. Nick and Simon brewed intense balanced beers that were and still remain “not normal” by conventional standards.    In November of 2005, after receiving numerous visitors to the brewery over the years, Three Floyds opened its own brewpub at the production facility. What was once office space is now a refuge for the craft beer enthusiast. With all the Three Floyds mainstays, seasonal offerings, special small batch beers and many guest beers it is a mecca for craft beer. The pub also has a full service kitchen providing pub fare of the best quality supported by a 3000 square foot organic herb and vegetable garden.

name: Charlottesville
description: On June 3, 1781, in the heart of the Revolutionary War, Jack Jouette made his legendary horseback ride to Charlottesville to warn Governor Thomas Jefferson and his legislators of an attempt at their capture by an advancing British Calvary.  Led only by moonlight, Jack rode 40 miles along a backwoods trail marked by three distinct axe notches in the trees, a path later known as Three Notch'd Road.  We here at Three Notch'd Brewing Co. will never be as legendary as some of the most revered characters in Virginia history, but we do aim to leave our humble mark in the world of craft beer.    Jack left his mark, we're leaving ours, how will you leave yours?    Three Notch'd Brewing Company, LEAVE YOUR MARK.

name: Three Rivers Eatery And Brewhouse
description: The Three Rivers Eatery and Brewhouse was established in 1997 by John Silva, Bob and Cindy Beckley in Farmington, New Mexico. The restaurant and brewery is located in downtown Farmington, on 101 East Main Street. It was formerly called the Andrews Building, and was built and opened in 1912. It was built to house The Farmington Drug Store and The Farmington Times-Hustler Newspaper (now The Daily Times), which became the longest standing drugstore and fountain in New Mexico.    The unique decor consists mostly of priceless items found in the building during the renovation. Three Rivers believes in preserving their historical heritage of downtown Farmington. The restaurant was expanded in July, 1999. The addition includes an outdoor private patio, a bar, and the largest beer label and beer coaster collections in New Mexico. The restaurant has occupancy to provide for large party dining and special private parties. We also sell t-shirts, caps and 1/2 gallon jugs of all our brews.

name: Three Skulls Ales
description: Avast, ye scurvy dogs! Three Skulls Ales celebrates those scallywags who traveled the Caribbean seas pillaging anything they could get their hands on.  Of course we all know that those pirates who roamed the seas were a nasty lot.  But they certainly did enjoy large amounts of good grog!  We also celebrate those few women who took to the seas to join the men who thirsted for booty.  They were as fierce as the men!  Enjoy!

name: Three Spirits Brewery
description: Three Spirits is a microbrewery soon to be located in Southwest Charlotte. We will produce high quality, unfiltered craft beers served in a soothing environment. This will be a place like no other microbrewery you have been to in the past. Initially we will start with 4 different beers. A red lager, "Red Moon Rising", an IPA, "Hopper's Delight", a brown ale, "Agate Have It!", and a light golden ale called "Southern Bliss". There are 5 other recipes which will be released throughout the year. Pending finding the right spot, we hope to be open by the Fall.

name: Three Troupers Brewery
description: The Three Troupers, William, Macgregor and George, cousins from Balmoral in Scotland, travelled to the Victorian goldfields in the summer of 1853.    With next to nothing in their sporrans (and even less under their kilts), but with their heads crammed with native wit, they determined to seek their fame and fortune.    They succeeded in this ambition, not through sinking shafts – or, as they put it in their blunt Gaelic way, “digging holes in the ground” – but through making a far more valuable, and less taxing discovery: liquid gold.    With becoming immodesty the three cousins named their distinctive Pale Ale, Amber Ale and Wheat beer after themselves.    And who can blame them?    Now, over 150 years later, the descendants of William, Macgregor and George, David and Marianne Troup, with loving, painstaking enthusiasm, are continuing their legacy.

name: Three Weavers Brewing Company
description: We created Three Weavers with one goal in mind: create a community through beer.  We believe in spending time with family and friends.  We craft beers that promote such gatherings.  The seasonality and variety of our products give reason to frequently gather, share and to become a community.    We are a craft brewery based in Inglewood, California.  Founded in 2013, we are deeply rooted in the concept of responsibility - to our environment, to our industry, to our community, and to our employees. Three Weavers exists to share our love and appreciation of beer with the world.

name: Throwback Brewery
description: Throwback is a small, inspired brewery dedicated to crafting delicious, farm-fresh beers from local ingredients.  Our goal at Throwback is to acquire most of our ingredients (such as hops, wheat, barley, fruit, and spices) from local farmers.  While we are not quite there today, it is our vision that eventually 100% of our ingredients will be sourced locally, including the malt.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri: 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sat: 1:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: ThumbCoast Brewing Company
description: Your Port Huron craft beer destination! 20 beers on tap, all the time, from our own brewery and other great breweries from around the Country.

name: Thunder Canyon Brewery
description: Thunder Canyon Brewery, Located in the foothills Mall in Northwest Tucson opened in November of 1997.    Tucson's most award winning brewpub. Locally owned and independent.     Our objective is simple: We serve the finest, hand-crafted beers produced from a working, on-site brewery; we offer healthy, contemporary bistro-style cuisine; and we serve it all up in a fun, clean and friendly environment.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Wed: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm  Thu - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm

name: Thunder Road Brewing Company
description: Our theme for 2013 was aroma hops. Over 50 brews later, our crowning glory Hop Star Extra Pale Ale has proven to be aromatic, enduringly complex yet balanced. But in 2014 our brewing focus is botanicals. More than 100 rare botanicals will be trialled and lots of beers brewed. So expect great tasting new beer experiences in 2014.

name: Thunderhead Brewing Company
description: Every Thunderhead can begins life in Kearney, NE.
hoursOfOperation: Mon:	1:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Tue:	7:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Wed:	5:00 pm - 12:00 am  Thu - Sat:	11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun:	11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Thwaites Brewery
description: Daniel Thwaites of Lancashire has been brewing beers for over 200 years. Today we brew a range of beers for all tastes and occasions. What our customers want has changed over our long history however the one thing that remains unaltered is our passion to use our skill and care to craft beers of the highest quality using the best natural ingredients available, sourced from farmers that we have known for years.    Our great cask ales can be enjoyed in many pubs across the country and our distinctive bottled ales are perfect to enjoy at home.     In addition to our main beer range we have developed seasonal cask ales of interesting and different beers called The Signature Range. This not only offers a wider choice but a chance for our brewers to experiment and demonstrate their brewing skills whilst allowing you sample some delightful creations from our brewery in Blackburn.

name: Tibbs Brewing Company
description: Tibbs Brewing Company was created to produce hand crafted, high quality, small batch craft beers. We will be brewing on a one barrel (31 US gallons) system to allow for constant experimental batches, while maintaining a core group of staple beers

name: Tibet Lhasa Brewery Company
description: The Tibet Lhasa Brewery Company Ltd. in Lhasa, Tibet is the world’s highest commercial brewery located at 11,975 feet in elevation and it is the only one in the Tibetan Autonomous Region. The brewery is a joint venture equally owned by a domestic corporation and a Danish investment led by The Carlsberg Group, one of the world’s largest brewers. It produces 85% of all beer sold in Tibet. It is the sole source of Lhasa Beer, “Beer from the Roof Of The World.”

name: Tied House Brewery & Cafe
description: Tied House is the South Bay's original microbrewery. Family owned and in operation since 1988. We feature hand crafted brews and yummy pub grub.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Fri: 11:30 am - 11:00 pm  Sat: 11:30 am - 10:00 pm  Sun: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm

name: San Jose
description: Tied House is the South Bay's original microbrewery. Family owned and in operation since 1988. We feature hand crafted brews and yummy pub grub.

name: Tight Lines Brewery
description: Tight Lines Brewery creates home-crafted beers right in the heart of Brookings, OR. We are family owned and operated and look forward to sharing our family's passion with you and yours.

name: Tight Lines Brewing Company
description: Tight Lines Brewing Company will be Morehead City's only operating brewery and restaurant. Founded in a historic building in downtown Morehead City, Tight Lines will capture the heritage and lifestyle of Carteret County through producing premium brews.

name: Tighthead Brewing Company
description: Tighthead Brewing Company was founded in 2010 by Owner and Master Brewer, Bruce Dir. Like most brewery adventures, the dream goes back many years and has uncountable iterations. The final version came down to one man finally finding the heart, with a little shove, to drop out of Corporate America and follow what is every brewers dream...opening your own brewery!

name: Timeless Pints Brewing Company
description: Lakewood's first microbrewery!     On Father's Day, several years ago, my son and I purchased a home brewing kit for my husband. As an Engineer and a lover of craft beer, he was excited to experiment with his own concoctions. Since his first trial run, he's produced multiple variety of stouts, ales, lagers and IPA's as well as very happy friends, family and neighbors. His love for the unique keeps him constantly in search of "new and different" ingredients and the hope of a perfect combination.    One hot July evening, some friends disclosed they were embarking on a new restaurant idea. They asked Chris (my husband) if he would brew the beer specifically for their new endeavor. The ABC frowns on beer sold without the proper licensing and selling from the kitchen counter is not a viable option. Thus a new venture began.    What was once a dream is now a reality and we can now bring our own craft beer to our local Lakewood/Long Beach community. You'll find us just behind the Long Beach Airport.
hoursOfOperation: Thu: 4:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Fri: 2:00 pm - 8:00 pm  Sat: 12:00 pm - 7:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

name: Timmermans
description: Timmermans brews only traditional Lambic; the basic beer that, from spontaneous fermentation, is used throughout the entire range. Brewing Lambic, without adding yeast, is a complex and subtle art requiring recipes and patience passed on by the family. Lambics survive thanks to a handful of Brussels breweries and the presence of two micro-organisms that exist only in the Senne Valley: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis and Brettanomyces Lambicus. By adding fruit and spices, the magic of traditionallymade beers unravels: Strawberry, Kriek, PÃ?Âªche, Framboise, Forest Fruit, but also Oude Gueuze, Kriek Retro, Gueuze, Faro or Lambicus Blanche. A unique site: open daily (including weekends), booking required. Possibilities for your meetings and banquets.

name: Timothy Taylor
description: Timothy Taylor’s prize-winning Yorkshire Beers and Ales are brewed in Keighley. The main brands are Boltmaker, Golden Best and Landlord – all award winning cask ales. The Brewery has been brewing premium cask beers since 1858 and also produces Landlord in a bottle. Landlord has won the Brewing Industry’s Gold Medal in the Keg, Cask and Bottled Ale competitions. It has also won first prize at the Great British Beer Festival on numerous occasions. Timothy Taylor’s Brewery is the last family brewery of its kind in West Yorkshire producing prize winning traditional ales and beers.

name: Tin Man Brewing Company
description: Tin Man Brewing Co. was assembled in 2012, an alloy of production brewery and restaurant. Committed to sustaining a habitable environment for all living and mechanical being, we utilize innovative processes to minimize waste and maximize taste. Forging new ground, we were one of the first small craft breweries in the United States to use a mash filter.

name: Tin Roof Brewing Co
description: Tin Roof Brewing Company is a local brewery in Baton Rouge, Louisiana with an uncompromising commitment to exceptional quality.    Tin Roof beers are handcrafted using only the finest American and European malts, freshest hops and pure parish well water. No preservatives or additives are ever used. This means you enjoy the natural flavor of the beer the way it was intended. Our beer is consistent, delicious, and has an unmistakable Southern charm - you’ll know it when you taste it.

name: Tin Whiskers Brewery and Taproom
description: The three founders of Tin Whiskers Brewing Co., LLC are George Kellerman, Jake Johnson, and Jeff Moriarty. They first met in 2005 while going to the University of Minnesota for bachelor degrees in Electrical Engineering. Over time, they all worked together as hardware design engineers for a small engineering services company specializing in RF-centric products. Being young engineers working downtown Minneapolis, they attended various happy hours together. It quickly became clear that they all really loved craft beer and were very intrigued with the science of the brewing process.    Jake and Jeff are the two brewers of the company who designed and honed the recipes. They got their start in 2006 brewing extract kits on Jake's Mom's kitchen stove much to her chagrin. (A few boil-overs did occur on her stove, whoops!) They brewed countless extract kits until in 2010, when after touring Surly and Flat Earth, they were inspired to turn their passion (like the founders of those breweries) into a business. From that point forward it has been all grain brewing and loving it. Nowadays, Jake focuses on the brewing aspect of the business while Jeff focuses on the brewing as well as the business side of the operation.    George, in the early years, was a force within the brewery by helping out at every brew session and providing needed muscle for cleaning and moving material around the brewhouse. He focused a lot on the quality of our beer and pushed us to design better more complex beers. He has moved on to be in charge of our online presence including developing our own beer wiki engine.

name: Tipping Point Tavern
description: Here at Tipping Point Tavern you will find the finest artisan smoked meats, local beers, good friends and a relaxed atmosphere. We use as much local meats and produce as possible in the kitchen. Whether you are from around the world or around the corner we guarantee you will have a good time at the tavern.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thurs: 11:30am till Midnight  Fri & Sat: 11:30am till 1:00am  Sun: 11:30 till 9:00

name: Tired Hands Brewing Company
description: We value local over imported, small batches over mass production, and striking a successful balance between giving back to our community and personal profit. Localization guides everything we do, from sourcing raw ingredients and materials, to employing area talent.    Tired Hands Brewing Company will operate at 16 Ardmore Avenue, Ardmore Pa, on a six barrel brewhouse. We will focus our brewing on two very broad styles of beers that hold a special place in my heart: Belgian/French farmhouse ales and American hop-forward ales.    All cheeses, meats, and seasonal produce served at our cafe (simple and satisfying fare from honest local producers) will be sourced from within 100 miles of our brewery.

name: Titletown Brewing
description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

name: Tivoli Brewing
description: The Tivoli Beer story traces its roots to 1864, when German immigrant Moritz Sigi founded a brewery in the newly settled town of Denver. Taken over in 1900 by John Good and renamed Tivoli, this brewery would become one of the largest breweries in the West, selling its light golden lager nearly everywhere west of the Mississippi until closing its doors in 1969. In 2012, a group of Colorado Natives formed the Tivoli Distributing Company to bring this Colorado legend back to life.

name: To Øl
description: In 2005, sat Tobias Emil Jensen and Tore Gynther at a party at their old high school with their teacher Mikkel Borg Bjergsø and spat into a flat sickly lager. The three talked about that it was too bad that you could not get some decent beer and agreed that the only way to ensure quality was about to brew it yourself. They were allowed to borrow the canteen in the school's closing and began to brew. This meant however that most of the brew was made between the hours of 22 and 6 on weekdays, which resulted in some hard school day for both the two pupils and the teacher, but the beer was appreciated by all the school (near the school cafeteria, which grumbled over filth ).    Later created Mikkel brewery Mikkeller , which has garnered wide international recognition, while Tobias and Tore moved their production into their parents' basement after they were dropped out of high school. Here they continued to hand brew until in 2010 found that two beers were now ripe to make its first commercial brew. Word spread and when it came Mikel for pennies, he insisted on making a collaborative brew between Mikkeller and Two Beers, who became the first beer Two release - Bib IIPA

name: Toasted and Tapped Brewery and Restaurant Flowery Branch
description: Toasted and Tapped began as a challenge to a group of friends.  The challenge was to take our combined skills and create a brewpub that excels in providing tasty beers, inspired food, and excellent customer service.  After meeting in college, the group entered the work place to refine the skills required to create and operate a successful brewpub.  In January of 2010, with inspired council from family, Paul Coggins relocated to Georgia to focus the group on one purpose.  With the help of God, the group was charged to create the best dining experience for the community.  After many months of construction, permitting, setbacks, and discoveries; Toasted and Tapped opened its doors to the public on November 26th, 2010.  We at Toasted and Tapped are excited to offer the best food, beer, and service we can to the community which gives us so much.
hoursOfOperation: Monday - Closed  Tuesday - Wednesday 11:00am - 10:00pm  Thursday 11:00am - 10:00pm (Team Trivia at 8pm)  Friday - Saturday 11:00am - Midnight  Sunday - Starting March 6th - 1pm to 9pm

name: Tofino Brewing Co.
description: Located on the west coast of Vancouver Island in British Columbia, Canada amidst picturesque mountains, endless ocean, and beaches that boast world class surfing.

name: TomCat Brewing Company
description: Closed in 1996. Became Pale Ale Brewing.

name: Tommyknocker Brewery
description: We are located in the Colorado Mountains in the cozy historic mining town of Idaho Springs. You can still feel the presence of the miners and see how the town looked during the mining days of the 1890’s.     Just 25 miles west of Denver and 20 miles east of Summit Co., we are easily found from either direction. Skiers can sit by our fireplace and warm up with a great beer after skiing or fill up on a delicious lunch on the way up to the slopes.

name: Tooheys Brewery
description: Tooheys is a brewery in the suburb of Lidcombe, in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. It produces beers under the Tooheys and Hahn trademarks, and is part of the New Zealand Lion Nathan beverages group.    Toohey's dates from 1869, when John Thomas Toohey (an Irish immigrant to Melbourne) obtained his brewing license. John Thomas Toohey and his brother James Matthew ran pubs in Melbourne (The Limerick Arms and The Great Britain) before moving to Sydney in the 1860s. They commenced brewing Tooheys Tooheys Black Old Ale in a brewery in the area of present day Darling Harbour. By 1875, demand for their beer had soared and they established The Standard Brewery in inner-city Surry Hills. In 1902, the company went public as Tooheys Limited, and commenced brewing lager (the present day Tooheys New) in 1930. In 1955, the brewery moved west to Lidcombe, where it is currently sited. In 1967, Tooheys bought competitor Miller's Brewers located in Tavener's Hill, closing the brewery in 1975.

name: Top Frog Brewery
description: Premium quality beer with a hometown feel.

name: Top of the Hill Restaurant and Brewery
hoursOfOperation: Restaurant is open everyday from 11:00 a.m. – 2:00 a.m.  Full Lunch Menu served until 3:00 p.m.  Full Dinner Menu served 5:00 p.m. – 10:00 p.m.  Limited menu served 3:00 – 5:00 p.m. and 10:00 p.m. – 2:00 a.m.

name: Top Rung Brewery
description: Top Rung Brewing is a 10 barrel production brewery with tasting room at the brewery. Top Rung Brewing is a destination for craft beer drinkers to enjoy their beverage and view a production brewery facility. Our tasting room is family friendly and while we will only offer snacks, we partner with local food vendors and food trucks as well as allow patrons to bring in their own food of their choice or have it delivered. Top Rung Brewing.....bringing quality craft beer to Lacey.

name: Top Shelf Brewery
description: Top Shelf Brewery is the newest brewery to hit Connecticut. It was created to provide top of the line locally hand crafted brews. After we finish all of the necessary paperwork with the government we will bring you the highest quality beer the area has to offer. Our 3 flagship beers will be available in stores around state as well as on draft in all of your favorite bars and restaurants. Our taproom will consist of 8+ taps where you will not only be able to drink our 3 flagship beers but many others that are only available in our taproom. All of these hand crafted beers will be available to go from our taproom via 22oz bombers.

name: Toppling Goliath Brewing Company
description: Toppling Goliath is a stealth brewery, flying fast, under the radar. This has been true since the day we quietly opened our first ½ barrel brewery and tap room on the west side of Decorah, IA in 2009. The batches were small but the taste was gigantic, and word spread like wildfire.    Today, our team brews at a larger production facility on the edge of town, regularly experimenting at the tap room to satisfy our craving for new and exciting creations. Numbers are not our game, making a lot of the same beer is just too boring, and life is just too short.    The history of Toppling Goliath lies in the dreams of tomorrow, not the pages of the past. The past is for those who rely on high volume and low value. The past is for those who duplicate rather than design. The past is for cowards. We are forward thinkers and cunning crafters, quietly building our revolution. “Big Beers Brewed in Small Batches.”
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu:	 12:00 pm - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 11:00 pm  Sun: 12:00 pm - 8:00 pm

name: Tow Yard Brewing Co.
description: We are a brewery, tasting room, and restaurant located in downtown Indianapolis. Our draft list is made up of our own beers, brewed under the direction of Head Brewer Bradley Zimmerman, and a constantly rotating cast of other delicious brews. Our location is within walking distance of Banker's Life Fieldhouse, Lucas Oil Stadium, and The Indiana Convention Center.     Our restaurant, The Larder, offers a variety of delicious eats for lunch and dinner. Chef Tommy Thompson's menu reflects his South Florida/New Orleans upbringing and his travels across the U.S. and abroad.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm  Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 1:00 am  Sun: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm

name: Town Hall Brewery
description: The Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery (Town Hall) opened in October 1997 after its founders graduated from business school and spent a couple of years in corporate America.    Town Hall founders Pete and Scot met as seventh graders at Kromrey Middle School in Middleton WI.  At the tender age of 13 both knew what they wanted to do for a living... make and drink good beer.  Just kidding!!    To make a long story short, Pete and Scot spent their formative years playing baseball at the West Middleton Town Hall.  Ever since, the words "Town Hall" evoke memories of community, relaxing with friends and happiness.  When Pete and Scot were reacquainted in Minneapolis they opened the Town Hall.    Tucked away on the fringes of downtown Minneapolis, the Town Hall offers a refreshing alternative to other eating and drinking establishments.  Its relaxed environment attracts a diverse crowd of college students, business people, professors, theater patrons and many more.    The Town Hall makes some of the best beer in America and provides an atmosphere where its patrons can relax and enjoy them.  Please come and taste our award winning beer and fantastic food.  Food and beverages are served in our bar, dining room and lounge.  Outdoor seating is available on our spacious patio from April 1 (weather permitting) until the snow flies in winter.

name: Townsite Brewing
description: Townsite Brewing Inc is a microbrewery located in the historic Townsite district of Powell River, at the top of BC’s beautiful Sunshine Coast. Our core values are:    1. Brew world-class beers  2. Promote beer culture and the responsible enjoyment of beer  3. Use sustainable business practices  4. Promote local economy and regional self-reliance  5. Support environmental stewardship and social responsibility  6. Kindle social, environmental and cultural change    As you can see, we are passionate about sustainability and community but more than anything, we are passionate about really great beer and frankly, we’re ecstatic that we get to make it in this amazing place along the shores of the Salish Sea. Our brewer engineer, Cedric, is Belgian and if there is one thing Belgians know, it’s how to make really great beer, and he’s excited to bring some Belgian flair to the west coast. Come visit us soon and see what he’s up to!

name: Toxic Brew Company
description: The Toxic Brew Company is a brewpub in downtown Dayton’s Oregon District. We brew and serve our beer on premise at 431 E. Fifth St. Dayton, OH, in the middle of the Oregon District. The TBC (Toxic Brew Company) is the first brewery in over 50 years to produce beer in downtown Dayton, OH.

name: Track 7 Brewing Company
description: The Graham and Scott families established Track 7 Brewing Company as an outlet for creative expression through unique and artisanal beers. The name, Track 7 Brewing Company, was selected in part due to the brewery’s proximity to the old Western Pacific railroad tracks, west of Curtis Park, and as a nod to the integral role the railroad has and continues to play in Sacramento’s rich history.    Track 7's approach to beer is in the vein of the firmly-hopped West Coast tradition, but without fidelity to a singular “style”. This unfocused approach allows Track 7 to experiment with all varieties of beer, regardless of American, Belgian, English, or German inspiration.
hoursOfOperation: Thu - Fri:	5:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sat:	2:00 pm - 9:00 pm  Sun:	12:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Wells Park
description: Tractor Brewing Co. produces world class beers. Come see the brewery. Try the beers and enjoy delicious BBQ next door! Open 7 days a week    Helping New Mexicans Get Plowed with Great Beer Since 1999.

name: Trade Route Brewing Company
description: At Trade Route Brewing Company, we like to think of ourselves as explorers charting the beer frontier. We are inspired by time honored brewing traditions of the world. We make beer for the adventurous. We make beer for you.

name: Trade Winds Brewing
description: Maui's first microbrewery.

name: Trafalgar Brewing Company
description: The Trafalgar Brewing Company (TBC) was founded by Mike and Nancy Arnold and George Hengstman in August 1993. For ten years TBC steadily built a reputation as a craft brewery specializing in uniquely brewed small batches of beer. In 2003, with the hugely successful introduction of three flavors of Mead to the Ontario market, TBC changed to Trafalgar Ales & Meads and is now recognized as one of Ontario’s most progressive small breweries.

name: Traffic Jam and Snug
description: The Traffic Jam and Snug, established 1965, is truly one of Detroit's hidden treasures. Known throughout Midtown for our in-house bakery, microbrewery, and dairy, our curiously intimate multi-level dining rooms, and an eclectic menu of made-from-scratch dishes, there is simply nothing quite like The Traffic Jam.

name: Trailhead Brewery
description: Trailhead Brewery is a 1-2 barrel nanobrewery where people can come enjoy locally made microbrews, chat directly with the brewmaster, and become involved in the overall experience of an ever evolving variety of craft brewed beers.    The brewmaster at Trailhead Brewery, Eli Smart, imparts different elements of his cultural experiences in this newly opened Akron, Ohio nanobrewery. Through growing up in Hawaii and living in Colorado, this Ohio State University graduate creates beautiful tasting beers in a relaxed atmosphere in the tradition of Colorado's "taste and tour" microbrew scene.    Trailhead Brewery is aptly named for being located on the Ohio & Erie Canal Towpath and Sand Run trails. The style and taste of beers also invites guests to be taken away to other famous trails around the United States and are named to invoke those images. This is Akron's place to go for exciting new beer tasting, for trailblazers, beer lovers, and novices alike.

name: Transient Artisan Ales
description: Transient Artisan Ales was formed not due to a lack of great beer, or with the intentions of growing a massive craft beer brand.  Rather, our goal is to recognize and appreciate the bounty of our local environment, take time to enjoy a simple and beautiful thing, and provide others the opportunity to do the same.    As the name Transient implies, our beers are meant to change with age, and even from batch to batch.  We use a blend of expressive yeasts and encourage the influence of the local Midwest microflora and the natural environment on our small-batch offerings through open-top fermentation.

name: Transmitter Brewing
description: Transmitter Brewing was formed to bring a unique perspective on traditional beer styles to the local NYC beer scene. Through the informed use and interactions of yeast and hops, we hope to add to the conversation about what is craft beer.

name: Trap Rock Restaurant and Brewery
description: Trap Rock Restaurant & Brewery opened its doors 1997 and combines seasonal craft brews with seasonal, American food. Designed by Morris Nathanson, Trap Rock Restaurant offers a working microbrewery and a comfortable European ski lodge atmosphere.

name: Trapp Family Lodge Brewery
description: More than a decade ago Johannes von Trapp started thinking about brewing his own beer, for guests of the resort. His dream was to produce an American version of the tasty Lager he has enjoyed over the years on his trips to the countryside near his ancestral Austrian home.     Johannes' dream became reality in the Spring of 2010, with the opening of the Trapp Family Brewery. The modest facility (60,000 or so gallons a year) is located in the lower level of the DeliBakery (formerly the Austrian Tea Room), where draughts of the heavenly concoction will be available year round.

name: Traveler Beer Company
description: At Traveler Beer Company we expand what craft beers can be by adding new flavors and discovering old traditions. We discovered the shandy tradition in Europe and are thrilled to bring this unique style of beer home, to you. Shandys exemplify everything we look for in a craft beer—they are different from the mainstream, fun, inviting, and social, and thanks to the finest ingredients, shandys taste amazing.    Curious?

name: Tree Brewing
description: Our story began in 1996, in beautiful Kelowna, British Columbia. Why Kelowna? Hey, having a Brewery in one of the most beautiful places in Canada seemed like a great idea. Why call the Brewery Tree? Well, it represents the natural beauty of British Columbia and the passion for all things natural and hand crafted, just like our beer. It's been an incredible ride since our first brew, a little like a roller coaster!    Our Brewing philosophy is simple, to brew memorable and flavourful beers regardless of the style...from our session beers to our Brewmaster's Reserve series. Our award winning beers are brewed by German trained Stefan Buhl and his team of passionate brewers. Using 100% Malted Barley, the Finest Hops, Yeast and Water, sure to satisfy the most discriminating tastes.    As a locally owned and operated Brewery, we believe in giving back to the communities that we work, live and play. From partnerships with the BC Fire ReLeaf Fund, Cops For Kids, Ski To Sea and the many charitable donations made throughout the year.    So when in Kelowna, drop by for a visit and we'll show you firsthand how to make great Craft beer!

name: Treehaus Brewery
description: Treehaus Craft Brewery is a start-up family owned and operated micro brewery located in Charlottesville, VA. Curious about our name? We were planning to start our brewing operation in a tree house! We lost the ability to acquire Treehouse as an LLC so we switched "house" to "haus" and voila! Treehaus Craft Brewery was born!    The treehouse fell through but we have started construction on our BrewHaus to house our test system so that we can perfect our recipes.     Our master brewer, Christoph Reinicke, attended Seibold Institute for brewing and interned with Starr Hill Brewery in Crozet, Va from 2011-2012. His mother Ann also attended Seibold, studying brewery management. Make sure you follow us on Facebook for the latest happenings! Thank you for checking us out and we hope to serve you soon!

name: Tri-City Brewing Company
description: Tri City Brewing is located in Bay City, Michigan, in the heart of the Tri Cities. Tri City Brewing was founded in 2007 by a local group of home brewers. Look around our website to learn more about our history and the beers that we brew.  Read more...

name: Triangle Brewing Company
description: We are a locally owned craft brewery situated in downtown Durham, North Carolina. Triangle Brewing Company is dedicated to producing well balanced, full-flavored, yet highly drinkable Belgian and American style ales.    Triangle beers are made with the finest hops and barley malt. Flavors harmonize, not fight for individual attention. Triangle beers are not pasteurized nor do we add preservatives (except for a healthy addition of hops). Seeing beer as equal to, if not superior to, wine, Triangle beers are designed to complement food. Because of this effort, soon one will be able to walk into any fine restaurant and pub in the Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill region and be pretty sure of finding a Triangle beer available.

name: Tribute Brewing Company

name: Trickster's Brewing Company
description: We are a production brewery nestled in Coeur d'Alene, Idaho just doing draft right now with bottles to follow by December 2012.  We have 5 year round brands which are as follows: Blonde Ale, Amber Ale, Brown Ale, IPA, and Extra Pale Ale along with seasonal beers that are always changing.

name: Trillium Brewing
description: We are a family owned and operated brewery in the Fort Point Channel neighborhood of Boston, Massachusetts. We created Trillium to realize our dream of bringing creative and flavorful beers to you. These beers are what we envision might have been made today, if a centuries old beer culture had naturally evolved in New England.  To achieve this vision, we stand our craft beers on the shoulders of native ingredients and artisan practices, balancing them with modern-day expertise.

name: Trillium Brewing Co.
hoursOfOperation: Tuesday - Friday, 4:00 - 7:30 PM  Saturday, 12 PM - 6:00 PM

name: Trim Tab Brewing
description: We craft beers of balance and celebrate the small, unassuming sources that create large-scale positive change - the trim tab. Boom.     Whats a trim tab you say? Look no further than the words of a genius published in a 1972 Playboy.....    “Something hit me very hard once, thinking about what one little man could do. Think of the Queen Mary [an ocean liner]— the whole ship goes by and then comes the rudder. And there's a tiny thing at the edge of the rudder called a trim tab. It's a miniature rudder. Just moving the little trim tab builds a low pressure that pulls the rudder around. Takes almost no effort at all. So I said that the little individual can be a trim tab. Society thinks it's going right by you, that it's left you all together. But if you're doing dynamic things mentally, the fact is that you can just put your foot out like that and the whole big ship of state is going to go. name: Tröegs Brewing Company
description: Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale).     In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery.     In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works.     The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others.     Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.    Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews.     Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.    www.troegs.com

They had found many excellent beers, but envisioned an ale that no one had made—one that would encompass bold American flavors and traditional European brewing techniques.  They asked Old Dominion Brewing Co., which they felt was one of the very best craft breweries in the country, to work with them to develop this ideal ale.  Tuppers’ Hop Pocket Ale was the result. name: Twin Lakes Brewing Company
description: In 1985, while attending the University of California at Berkeley, Samuel Hobbs wrote a chemistry paper, for a laugh, on “aqueous beer foam” (the head of a beer). Motivated by patriotic feelings and the American dream of creating a business, the energy was set in motion to start Twin Lakes Brewing Company. Weeks later, Sam and his longtime friends Matt Day, Jack Wick, and Mark Fesche developed a unique 15 gallon gravity fed pilot system and began working to create their first signature brews.    They decided to locate the brewery at the beautiful “Twin Lakes Farm” in Greenville, Delaware. This historic 252 acre farm has been in Sam’s family for seven generations and has a deep rock well aquifer which supplies perfect water for brewing. Local artisans converted an old tractor barn and art studio to accommodate a five vessel, gravity fed brewery and tasting room. Finally, on April 13, 2006, the first two brands, Greenville Pale Ale and Route 52 Pilsner, were launched. name: Uncle Bear's Brewhouse Grill
description: “COME, SIT AND STAY”    Who Was Uncle Bear, You Ask?             Well he was a fun loving good fella, of the Labrador mix named “Bear”. In the good ole’ days as a young pup, he could be found cruising the college campus at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, body surfin’ at Doggie Beach in Ocean Beach (San Diego), skiing down the snow capped mountains in Ruidoso, New Mexico, relaxing in the Hot Springs of Arkansas and finally making his home in the Valley of the Sun. Since Bear was an active dog and on the go, he wanted to create a place where he and his friends could “Come, Sit And Stay”.        Well Uncle Bears’ Brewhouse Grill is that place. Born out of Bear’s  love for craft beer and excellent food, we have created an upbeat, fun atmosphere where friends, family and co-workers can come to enjoy a variety of delicious menu selections & NOW our own locally brewed craft beer. The Uncle Bear’s Brewhouse opened in 2013, as well as the 4 Grill and Bar locations were re-branded to the Grill and Tap concept that same year.    On the menu, whenever you see Bear’s paw print  you can be assured the item is a long-term house favorite or a new favorite we are sure Bear would have loved. Try any one of the items from the “Famous” Sliders, Backyard Burgers and Birds, Big Plates and Serious Sizzles, Gourmet Pizza, Bear “Bites” or Wing selections and you are in for a true treat.        The unique motif has been designed to resemble all of the places Bear or your family dog would hang out such as the garage, backyard or home.     In addition to the excellent food menu, we feature fantastic house drinks and NOW a wonderful selection of craft beers brewed on site in our state of the art display brewery. Be sure to try a Flight Bone (5-4oz. tasters) or a Growler (64oz. take-home jug) or a pint of our craft beer. With all the goodies mentioned above and numerous sporting events on a slew of TV’s, we promise you will be treated to a “Doggone Good” experience compliments of our attentive, knowledgeable and enthusiastic team..

We are committed to recycling, reusing, and reducing our carbon footprint while at the same time making unique beers for discerning beer lovers and craft beer newbies. We will think local and will contribute to the local economy.   The beer we produce will be available in our brewery and at local bars, restaurants and liquor stores. description: Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee, America’s beer capital, only to discover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.    In fact, it was Schirf who proposed the bill to the Utah Legislature in 1988 that would make brew pubs legal in Utah. There are now more than 12 thriving brew pubs in the state thanks to Schirf and the bill's sponsor, Senator Mike Demeitrick of Price, Utah.

At Vallensons we like to experiment and thus far our beers have been very successful.     Vallensons plans to be different then the standard brewery by carving a niche out of the craft brewing industry. In 1994, Kellie Jacobs re-established the operations under the name of Valley Brewing Company Inc. and set out to build Valley Brewing Company into the premier brewery that operated in years past.    Over a decade later, Valley Brewing Company has won numerous awards for various beers such as Uberhoppy, West Coast IPA, Luna Blanca and London Tavern. The London Tavern won a silver medal in the 2010 World Beer Cup and Uberhoppy just recently won another prestigious award in 2011. Valley Brewing Company and will continue it's focus on brewing the San Joaquin Valley's top beers and provide our loyal customers with not only award winning beer but bragging rights that they represent Valley Brew! name: Veteran Beer Company
description: The Veteran Beer Company is dedicated to providing lives of quality for military Veterans through the creation of meaningful post-service careers. The company will produce, sell, and deliver beers of superior quality, striving to employ Veterans in every role within the organization and the supply chain while adhering to the highest principles of military service, conducting business with integrity, courage, and loyalty.

name: Veterans United Craft Brewery
description: Veterans United Craft Brewery is dedicated to satiating healthy appetites with flavorful beer through the use of fresh, quality ingredients and hope to expand the definition of what beer can be through our hard work and innovation. We also value ideas and technologies that reinforce our social and environmental responsibility to our local community.     Join us Wednesday through Saturday in our brand new taproom to experience our beer right from the source. We'll be serving our flagship Raging Blonde Ale and Hopbanshee IPA, as well as taproom-exclusive brews and some great guest beers.     Take home a 32 or 128 oz. Growler or just enjoy a few pints.     Enjoy a tour of the brewery production area on Saturdays, from 1:30pm–4:30pm (one every hour; cost is $5 and includes a guided tour, tasting glass, and sample pours of our beers on tap).    Keep an eye on our Facebook and Twitter feeds or sign up for our e-newsletter to see when talented local musicians and delicious food trucks will be around.     Veterans United Craft Brewery is committed to making a positive contribution to Jacksonville and beyond, and we look forward to sharing a pint with you!

name: Vetter's Alt Heidelberger Brauhaus

We relish the opportunity to please both ourselves and our audience with our flavorful creations.  We've invested more than our lives in this. Take a look at Victory Brewing Company's Beers.

name: Vierling Restaurant & Marquette Harbor Brewery
description: In December 1995, the Vierling became one of Michigan’s first brew pubs with the addition of a five barrel micro-brewing system.  The brew equipment, direct from Budapest, Hungary is configured to produce some of the finest ales and lagers in 155 gallon hand-crafted batches.  The relatively small sized batches of beer insures a fast product turn-over which enables the Vierling to serve the freshest beer possible with a multitude of varieties.

name: Viking Braggot Company
description: Viking Braggot Company is Eugene's newest brewery and the only brewery to offer a full line of braggots! What are braggots? It is one of the oldest fermented drinks, pioneered by the Vikings that takes elements of beer and fermented honey (or mead). We are updating this ancient tradition by creating a modern beverage that combines local honey and organic craft beer ingredients!

name: Village Brewery
description: Let us gather for mutual benefit. And beer.    Some of the best things happen over beer. Ideas are born, friendships forged, deals struck. Village Brewery began that way too, with friends sharing beers and dreams for a community brewery. A brewery that would support Calgary’s artists and craftspeople. A brewery that would create the excellent ales and lagers our friends and neighbors deserve. It takes a village to raise a beer. And a beer to raise a village.

name: Village Idiot Brewing Company
description: Our brewery is a 1.5 BBL (46.5 gallons) artisanal, small-batch, neighborhood business brewing quality beer for good people who appreciate good beer.  We offer samples, pints, and growler fills. Our unique tasting room is situated at the location of the former Bridgetown Pub, just a short drive from NJ Turnpike Exit 5 or the Mt. Holly exit off 295. We combine fresh ingredients with beer education and a brewery tour to refresh, enlighten and inform.    Our limited brewery license prevents us from serving food, but  we encourage our customers to carry-in or order delivery from one of the many restaurants in downtown Mt. Holly within walking distance.    Village Idiot Brewing Company is a very unique concept that we have seen blend in and work successfully in other Main Street settings across the country.  Our small size allows us to be nimble and offer tap selections that change frequently.

name: Brewpub

name: Vine Park Brewing Company
